intro: Niphobolus linearifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its linear, often succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, this species thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is often found in coastal dunes and rocky outcrops, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora in its native habitat.
